noun.description: Ornamental or decorative work resembling rocks or shells.
Rocks and shells used to create ornamental figures and designs as decoration for a grotto or other garden feature. Compare "rocaille". Chiefly historical after 18th cent.
A natural mass or group of rocks.
Stones roughly piled together in imitation of natural rocks as an ornamental garden feature, especially a rockery.
Architecture. Masonry with a rough projecting face, giving the appearance of natural, freshly quarried rock. Compare rustic work. Now rare.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in William Foster (b. 1591), Church of England clergyman and writer. From rock + work.
